week_overview: This Base phase week focuses on building aerobic endurance with primarily easy runs and one key long run. A single bodyweight strength session will support overall running strength and injury prevention.

running_sessions.workout_description: An easy-paced run to build aerobic base. Focus on maintaining a conversational pace where you can comfortably speak in full sentences.
running_sessions.notes: Listen to your body and keep the effort low.

running_sessions.workout_description: Another easy run to accumulate volume and further develop your aerobic fitness. Concentrate on relaxed form and consistent effort.
running_sessions.notes: Enjoy the rhythm of your run. Hydrate well before and after.

running_sessions.workout_description: Your weekly long run. Maintain a steady, comfortable pace throughout. This run is crucial for increasing your endurance and mental toughness.
running_sessions.notes: Ensure you are fueled and hydrated. Consider carrying water or planning a route with water stops. Don't worry about speed, focus on completion.

exercises.name: Bodyweight Squats
exercises.form_cues: Keep your chest up, push your hips back as if sitting in a chair, and ensure knees track over toes. Go for full range of motion.

exercises.name: Walking Lunges
exercises.form_cues: Step forward, lower your hips until both knees are bent at approximately a 90-degree angle. Ensure your front knee is directly above your ankle and your back knee hovers just above the ground. Alternate legs.

exercises.name: Push-ups
exercises.form_cues: Start in a plank position, hands slightly wider than shoulder-width. Lower your chest towards the floor, keeping your body in a straight line from head to heels. Push back up forcefully. Modify on knees if needed.

exercises.name: Glute Bridges
exercises.form_cues: Lie on your back with knees bent, feet flat on the floor hip-width apart. Lift your hips off the ground until your body forms a straight line from shoulders to knees. Squeeze your glutes at the top.

exercises.name: Plank
exercises.form_cues: Hold a straight line from head to heels, engaging your core and glutes. Avoid sagging your hips or arching your back. Elbows directly under shoulders.
